code:
# @param {String} source
# @param {String} target
# @param {Character[]} original
# @param {Character[]} changed
# @param {Integer[]} cost
# @return {Integer}
def minimum_cost(source, target, original, changed, cost)
    n = source.length
    dp = Array.new(n+1) { Array.new(26, Float::INFINITY) }
    26.times { |i| dp[n][i] = 0 }
    change_map = {}
    original.each_with_index do |char, i|
        change_map[char] ||= {}
        change_map[char][changed[i]] ||= []
        change_map[char][changed[i]].push(cost[i])
    end
    (n-1).downto(0).each do |i|
        26.times do |j|
            dp[i][j] = dp[i+1][j]
        end
        next if change_map[source[i]].nil?
        change_map[source[i]].each do |key, costs|
            target_char = key
            costs.each do |c|
                dp[i][target[i].ord - 'a'.ord] = [
                    dp[i][target[i].ord - 'a'.ord],
                    c + dp[i+1][target_char.ord - 'a'.ord]
                ].min
            end
        end
    end
    ans = dp[0][target[0].ord - 'a'.ord]
    ans == Float::INFINITY ? -1 : ans
end
